gobblin.util.limiter

Class NonRefillableLimiter

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.util.limiter.NonRefillableLimiter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Limiter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CountBasedLimiter, RateBasedLimiter, TimeBasedLimiter

    public abstract class NonRefillableLimiter
extends java.lang.Object
implements Limiter
    A type of Limiters that do not support permit refills by returning a no-op Closeable in acquirePermits(long).

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • acquirePermits

        public java.io.Closeable acquirePermits(long permits)
                                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: Limiter
        Acquire a given number of permits.

        Depending on the implementation, the caller of this method may be blocked. It is also up to the caller to decide how to deal with the return value.

        Specified by:
        acquirePermits in interface Limiter
        Parameters:
        permits - number of permits to get
        Returns:
        a Closeable instance if the requested permits have been successfully acquired, or null if otherwise; in the former case, calling Closeable.close() on the returned Closeable instance will release the acquired permits.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the caller is interrupted while being blocked
